description:
I was in town Friday night from Santa Cruz looking to dance to some good electronic music. I really detest your average "club" and the snooty attitudes that come with it. 

This place was everything I wanted!! Good techno and a safe, judge free atmosphere. My friend who never dances felt comfortable to be himself. 

Thank you!!!
author: Tiffany M.

description: Left my jacket last weekend, and been trying to reach them by phone-# is out of service. A friend who lives down the street, has been going every night since they say they are open every night 10pm-2am. They have not been open 3-4 nights. The one night he did go in, someone picks a fight with him, and busts his back, and leg up. TERRIBLE UPDATES ON OPEN HOURS OF OPERATION, AND NO WORKING #!
author: Janet C.

description:
Great dive bar with small dance floor but with really good sound. 
A big fan of the monthly Techno/Minimal Friday nights by MNML:FUN. A rarity in San Francisco with a lot of house/electronic music but not a lot of regular and good quality Techno events.
author: Rubeun T.

description: $8 cover and then 25 minutes just to close out and get my credit card back, then the bartender gives me attitude? Not to mention the beer was room temperature and the place was 90 degrees. No thanks.
author: Dan W.

description: Been here for three separate events (host and day listed): Run The Length of Your Wildness Monday, Shelter Tuesday, MNMLFUN Friday. Staff is salty but capable, and the house music you'll hear is fantastic (and free for all the events I attended). Dance floor is small, but I've never felt crowded as most of the people seem to stick by the bar and lounge area. Check this spot out if you just wanna groove EDM-style without all of the ratchety stuff you will likely encounter at a larger venue.
author: John M.

description:
Fish tacos without question one of the best of the city. Great spot to watch games but you won't be able to hear the action. Might be a good thing depending if Joe Buck is the announcer. 
Tough to find parking so taking a cab would be the best way to go
author: Cesar B.

description:
I came here last weekend for the Hell'a Tight Party, a purported 90s themed dance party.  I had such high hopes for the venue and event; I challenge yelpers to find any kid of the 90s who wouldn't be excited for a 90s dance party.  I mean there's such great dance hits as "Groove is in the Heart", "What is Love?", "Rhythm is a Dancer" ... I could go on and on.

Sadly, I didn't hear many of the great 90s dance hits and in fact, I'd say about half the songs were actually from the 00s to the present (not the 90s).

My disappoint was compounded by the fact that I experienced the first thing I've ever experienced in my life: a bartender refusing to make a drink for me on the grounds that the bar is a "dive bar" and then walking away.  Well excuse me.  Last time I checked, dive bars do NOT have dance floors.  In any event, I consider that to be so incredibly rude and disrespectful of a patron.  Thankfully, there was another bartender who very politely made my drink after I reminded him how to make it. For those of you wondering, it was a Harvel Walbanger (OJ+Vodka+Galliano - all of which they had).

At the end of the day, I doubt I'll be going back to the underground but you never know, time makes crappy experiences seem somehow better.
author: Banana S.

description: I'm giving this business 1 star because they are constantly littering fliers all over the city and on my car. Please STOP. This club needs to find to find a better marketing strategy. No one sees their car spammed with crap and thinks hmmm after I'm done picking up all these annoying fliers off my car I'm really going to want to spend money at this establishment. The street I just walked on was covered with these all over the ground.
author: Mike D.

description:
Hmm, can be hit or miss. As in the last time I came for Cockfight on a Friday, it was packed to wall-to-wall with people, though I suppose it was for DJ Earworm. Plenty o' eye candy if the Castro scene is getting a little grating. Second time there, it was sparse and the music was best suited for epileptic fits and jerky jerk dance. There was also a drugged out zombie of a man lurching around the dance floor, ready to rub his sweaty fuzzy self on you. Please, please stop, enough sexy has been brought back.

$7 cover!
author: Kevin L.

description:
been here many times too see some awesome atmospheric D&B when it was called the Top w Blame & Mike B! 
also tons of times for other events, friendly folks at the bar! now a forthcoming event Worldly is happening! featuring awesome World Electronica featuring amazing talent that breaks all boundaries located off the legendary Haight Street def worth checking out u cant miss as there is occasionaly something happening here!
also thurs is Bubble great night for dancing!!
Tues d&B
author: Djinn G.

description:
interesting for a Thursday night.

crowded and musty, but what do you expect for a Thursday night.  Good mix of people and music.
author: Angelica C.

description: "Dive Club" and the worst of both worlds.  Tiny over-crowded dance floor.  Crappy bartenders.  Homie with the grungy long hair takes 10 minutes to make anything other than beer it's like wooooooow.
author: Marlin D.

description: Underground SF is one of the last real SF dance bars of the OG UG SF! Keep it real Underground SF! Be ready for grit and kinda messy bathrooms! ;) Love you Underground SF - aka The Top! :) Mwah! xoxo...
author: Forest G.

description: A slice of "old" San Francisco, alive and thriving! Stay the hell away if you're expecting whatever bullshit they're playing on the radio or anything resembling bottle service (and the BS sense of entitlement that comes with it). If you wanna get sweaty and rave all night this is the joint.
author: Mike B.

description:
I think Underground SF maybe the only place to go out for dancing and live music on the Lower Haight. New, awesome owner & management and they are turning this dive bar into a community hotspot once again.

Friendly, low key vibe for all kinds of folks. Cool bar staff. Be sure to check out their new Wednesday night  indie live music & art night, featuring an awesome line-up of local talent throughout the summer.
author: Jana C.

description:
Love this place! 

One of the most underrated bars in SF with an up and coming Local Live Music Night every Wednesday, some awesome DJ nights throughout the rest of the week (Inc. D n' B tuesdays!) + a history of bangin' nights in the past (Gemini Disco!) 

This place is another delightful watering hole in the Lower Haight and is only gonna get better under the new ownership too!
author: Alex W.

description:
Only okay for entertainment value.  While I was there, the music included: Mandy Moore, Spice Girls, N'Sync (twice), Britney, Christina, Hanson, Ace of Base, and Natalie Imbrugila.

My friend went to the bathroom and said someone had a huge bag of cocaine and was offering it to people.

Also, they had one woman who served as a dancer, the DJ, and a bartender.
author: Ryan S.

description: 5 stars for Bubble Thursday's. If you like house music, no frills bar it's the place to be. They often have fresh grapefruit for greyhounds, yummy.
author: Geri S.

description:
I honestly think that Underground SF is one of my favorite bars in San Francisco. It's small, it's divey, it's unassuming. But perhaps I like it because it's a gay bar outside of the ever-straightening Castro. 

Underground SF hosts a lot of weekly or monthly parties. For me, the nights to go here are definitely Saturdays. 1st and 3rd Saturdays are for the ever-popular Cockfight, where the bar is FILLED with MEN-- and very few annoying drunken Castro queens. Go-Go boys takeover the bar and stage-- usually one has a panda head.

The second Saturday was reserved for Mall Madness-- a bubblegum pop night with music and drag, although this will be going on hiatus post-June. Currently, newish party Indie Cent is thrown on the fourth Saturday, with indie-electro music and drag.

The bar itself is narrow and long, with the bar to your right. The bar tenders are mixed in taste but almost always shirtless. There are a few short stairs that lead you to the dance floor-- depending on the night there is a stage. There is a smoker's patio in the back (albeit small) and the line for bathrooms can get ridiculously long, since there are only two single-stall bathrooms. 

Needless to say, this bar has quickly become my Saturday night home and it's definitely a place I recommend people go when they need to escape the mess that is the Castro on Friday or Saturday night.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Great venue for local live music on Wednesday nights! The hotspot for indie music in the Lower Haight.

Great staff, cheap drinks, great atmosphere.

New ownership has seen the place transformed for the better - clean bathrooms, clean bar, great smoking patio.
author: Dave J.

description: I used to come to this spot on Tuesdays a few years ago for Drum & Bass and jungle and after being out of the city for a while was very pleasantly surprised to find it's still going. Better yet, it sounds really good now (even though I liked the night, there were sound problems back in the day). All the DJs had proper selections and one guy was actually spinning records (yes, vinyl ones)! Not as packed as it was years ago,but there's almost no Drum & Bass in SF anymore, so for me this was like an oasis in the desert. If you're looking for dnb or just a fan of broken beats I'd recommend it.
author: Killa B.

description: Drum.and.bass Tuesdays! Looking to link up with the junglist crowd? Pretty casual vibe here. Even as an out-of-towner I felt pretty welcome. A chill (and free!) weekly to dance away your mid-week bass crave.
author: Dessa R.

description:
I am always fully aware of my surroundings when I enter Underground SF.  I leave barely clinging to the knowledge of what my name is.  This would be more fitting if I ever managed to have more than one drink here.  There's got to be some magic gay ju-ju going on here or I might be more of a trainwreck than I want to believe.

What I foggily remember from days after is darkness, loud music, and dancing.  They also have a coat check.  I am certain I will be back, I just hope that next time I remember more accurately the evening.  Or maybe I don't.

*always in this context means twice
author: Jeremy G.

description:
The best Tuesday night in the whole city. All hail the SF DnB pioneers that have essentially started their careers here (Phunckateck, Phuturo, Groundscore, to name but a few) and for continuing to push the scene for years and years.

Of all of the bars I've been to in the city, this one is by far the most fun to drink at. Loud, funny, wise-cracking bartenders pouring 'em strong.

The dance floor isn't huge by any means and it gets really crowded in there. And prepare to wait for the bathroom for quite awhile. And you'll need it, 'cause you will be drunk as a skunk.

Carrying on the tradition, check out 'Shelter' on Tuesday nights. Legit party by legit people at a legit venue.
author: Jon M.

description: changed owners two years ago, change brought a kick ass sound system. i love this club - this place has the making of a kick ass party with a kick ass dj.
author: Wakako U.

description:
"What's up for tonight?"

"Underground SF"

"Yeah, so where is it located?"

"Underground SF"

Forever, I kept thinking my friend was telling me we were going to a real underground, as in at an undisclosed location. Yeah, I have blonde moments now and then. Don't judge.

$1 well drinks. Seriously, I do not know how that happened, nor do I know if this is a usual deal.

It's grimy, it's gritty, it's good... good enough. If you like drum n bass and cheap drinks in a dive atmosphere, you can't miss this place on Tuesdays for Shelter.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
A bit late with the cliched "underground SF" bar name, whatever I still refer to it as "the Top" as do most here in San Francisco.   Drunk and Horny seems to be the current party pulling for this bar.  While it was fun sometime about last year in 2005. It's evident that this event has outgrown this venue.  Getting drunk is a challenge within itself...pay the $5 buck cover then get crammed into the narrow bar as if you were getting shoved onto a commuter train in Japan.  Seriously, pushing your way to the bar takes some mad skill!  A couple of spilled drinks, getting your feet stepped on, and some aggressive shoving gets you to the equally packed dance floor.  

Dance or just attempt to or just stand there and get unintentionally groped to the campy 70's-90's music.  Okay promoters, now that you got the crowd, I'm sure you'd have a loyalty of followers who'd love another venue to accommodate a larger crowd.  But kudos for doing something outside of the Castro mold...looks like you got em' where you want them!

What began as Drunk and Horny has transformed itself to Sober Horny and overcrowded, and the crowds seem to grow larger by the week.  It's most likely one fire hazard away from catastrophe, a paramedics worst nightmare. I wouldn't want to be there in the slightest of tremor/ earthquake, the place would just collapse or deflate.
author: B H.

description:
If you like small, neighborhood bars with a rockin' dancefloor soundsystem this is your place!

Check the night. They have really specific things going on. The night I went had an array of great DJs and a couple live electronica acts. It was a great night and a good crowd. Check it out!
author: Glen T.

description:
My friends and I hit this place up last night, but we all left disappointed. 7 dollar cover was the first strike. The next strike was the crowd. If you're a 40 year old white dude, and you like other 40 year old white dudes, then you will be in heaven. Otherwise you'll be scratching your head trying to figure out the appeal. Oh and last but not least, The Smell! You could smell the bathrooms of this place in the whole club, like having a party inside a port-o-potty... a port-o-party.  

Anyway, the only saving grace was the music. Like everyone else has said, its pretty cool, oldies and new hits all mixed together.  But its not enough to make me want to ever go back.  No more cockfighting for me.
author: Chris T.

description:
They have gay nights twice a month - it's either the 1st and 3rd Saturday, or the 2nd and 4th. Honestly, who keeps track of these things?

The crowd is grittier and less pretentious than what you find at those barfy Castro bars (I'm looking at you, Boy Bar). On my first visit, I ran into not one but TWO long-lost friends. Clearly this place attracts the right kind of people.

The bathroom is both filthy and kind of exposed, with the crapper next to the sink and only a curtain to hide you. There's a secluded alley next to the building. Fortunately this isn't the kind of joint where people are bothered by semi-public urination.

I don't remember how much drinks were but not expensive. I like this place, I just wish it was more gay.
author: Ben C.

description: I can't believe this place. They wouldn't let me in because the bouncer said the ID didn't look like me???? IT"S MY ID, IT'S ME! I had to wait for the owner to come out and also tell me my ID was fake. OK
author: Ian D.

description: There was a go-go boy wearing a giant panda head. Five stars.
author: Kenneth L.

description: I had a blast at "cockfight" last night. It was super crowded, the guys were hella hot - the hipster queers type. The music was fantastic, lots of little boots, robyn, and other pop gems. I met a 70 year old queer guy who loves to dance, was really rad and had lots of cool stories to tell. The gogo boys in wrestler uniforms were really hot, and where else can you see a guy with a big stuffed panda head dancing in a jockstrap?
author: Mark S.

description:
I find it funny its considered a Gay venue when its only a gay party once a week.

Ive had the honor to party and DJ here for the past few years at select ragga jungle/drum&bass events. Some of the best DNB parties in SF occur at this place. Tuesdays you usually find "SHELTER" which plays host to the best Drum&Bass, Dubstep and Reggae beats from the BADNB collective with special guests all the time. Serious DNB/DUBSTEP business. This club plays host to the best of the best.

Drinks. They are poured super strong by the owners/bartenders. Shots of Fernet, Shots of Patron, Grey Goose/Red Bulls, Whatever you want, They got it. Cover is usually non-existent or a minimal $5, depending on event. Its out in the Lower Haight. The crowds and vibes are always cracking. If you love Jungle, DNB & Dubstep, This is your venue, At least 2x a week.
author: Alex M.

description: I was here for the first Sat of the month deal and it was fun - I forget what it is called. It was a mixed crowd (ages, orients, gends,) , DJ and music was good.  Some eye candy and such... The cover is $5-7 so that is fine....I'll be going back with my honey.
author: Cristian M.

description: this has been a staple spot for drum & bass since i moved to the city in 2000. i love this spot. good sound, good prices, great vibes...
author: Joey M.

description:
Went here on a Wednesday night last November in 2007 for some hip-hop wannabe Sneaker Pimps event that some of my USF friends were going to.  I forget what happened, but the only good thing about this place was the drink specials and dive bar drink prices.  Place looked like some ghetto warehouse on the inside.  Could be cool with the right crowd, but it was just kinda dead that night.  Maybe it was cause we showed up early since we didn't wanna have to pay a cover, but it didn't look like there was gonna be a cover that night.

It's located right by Fillmore, so it's kind of ghetto at night on the streets.  So don't get too sad if you come back to your car getting jacked over here, especially if you drive a SUV with all those crazy green environmentalist around Haight Street.

I forget what we did after, but I think we went to Rohan or some Korean Bar on Geary to meet up with some friends since I'm sure we didn't go to Milk or Poleng that night since it was a Wednesday.
author: Chris T.

description: Stopped in to check out Cockfight tonight. Perhaps we left too early, I don't know, but it was hella boring. It was tiny, it was dirty, and the crowd wasn't very cute. Also, the drinks were expensive and parking was bad. Just not a fan, at all...
author: Sean B.

description:
GayBoy:  Heeeeey.... don't I KNOW you from somewhere?

StraightBoy:  Oh yeah!  Didn't we meet at that party?

GayBoy:  Yeah!  So ... are you SURE you're not GAY?

StraightBoy:  *laughing nervously*  Hahaha...  Yeah ... I'm not gay.
  
GayBoy:  Because if *SHE* weren't here I'd be SO hitting on you!  

**Gay Boy shoots Lulu look of death**

Lulu:  **Crab-walking my way to the other end of the bar.  Walking away.  Walking far, far, away, for fear of breaking a nail, getting b*tch-slapped and having my hair-pulled in an all-out catfight with a Man, Baby!**

Awesome tunes on Wednesdays.  And the bathrooms are dreadful.
author: lulu p.

description:
Didn't much care for this place when it was The Top, and don't much care for it now. 

Great visiting DJs blah, blah, blah........

Who the hell thought up putting a (very small) dance floor right in between the bar and the restrooms.....you literally have to wait in line ON THE DANCE FLOOR to go to the bathroom. Do you think we all wait so long that by the time we hop in line we are in "pee pee dance" mode??

Well, maybe sometimes....but still.....
author: Drue C.

description:
I went there pretty drunk already. the space is kinda small but I like that it's pretty crowded. The inside looks better than the outside. I thought it was pretty sketch from the neon pink sign, but it's better inside. 
There wasn't anything that special about this place, but I'll go here if I don't have anything else to do.
author: Miss C.

description:
My evening at Underground SF, a play in two parts:

Act I:
(Kate K. standing outside Double Dutch NOT SMOKING *cough* with Drue C. following the Elite event at the Roxie Cinema - enter Sav B. and KPakaCelebguru)...

KPaka: Kate!  Drue!  What are you doing?
Kate: Not smoking, that's for sure, KP.
Sav: No what are you doing AFTER THIS?
Drue: What are YOU doing?
KPaka: We are going to Underground SF, you are coming.
Kate: No, no, no... no, no, no - I have to be at work really early tomorrow.  Bad, bad idea.
Sav: I have to be at work, too - I am going so can you.
Kate: How early?
Sav: Early.
Kate: Early for me or early for you?
Sav: Early for you.
Kate: And, you're going?
Sav: Yes.
Kate: Okay I will go for ONE DRINK.  ONE - do you hear me?  Single, uno, ONE... then I really have to go home.
KPaka: Yay!

(Sav and KPaka do a little jig in the middle of 16th Street, Kate and Drue put out the cigarette they are NOT SMOKING and go back into the Double Dutch)

Act II - in TXT messages:
(Kate is in line on the dance floor for the bathroom at Underground SF, she looks around for Sav to commiserate at the lameness of the bar - as it is dead, smells like Nag Champa incense and is filled with hippies dancing to weird trance music... she is fully expecting him to pop out of the woodwork and say "Fuck this skeevy hippy shit, let's go to Jade" at any moment.)

Kate TXT: Where R U?
(Kate waits... she figures Sav is somewhere in a corner with his girlfriend - his Sidekick - and, he will text back almost immediately... which... he does.)

Sav TXT: I gotta get ready for tomorrow work, so gotta read stuff now.  At home.  Enjoy the party tho.

(IMPOSSIBLE!  The party boy of the Western world bailing?)

Kate TXT: SAV!  Get ur heiney here - I hve 2 B @ wrk @ 6am - LAME!

(Almost immediately...)

Sav TXT: Sorry Kate sweetheart, weekend.  Ok?

(You're kidding me right?)

Kate TXT: Lame!!!!!!

****
Some or all of this conversation may have been... Er, exaggerated *slightly* in order for dramatic effect.  (Except the part about KP and Sav doing a jig in the middle of 16th Street and the fact that I was NOT SMOKING... both 100% true.)  The fact which was not exaggerated was the fact that this bar pretty much sucked.  Weird layout, smelled like Nag Champa, the drinks were overpriced (I paid for a well vodka and cranberry what I paid for a Kettle One and cranberry at the Double Dutch earlier...) 

What I did like was the weird barbershop chairs they had at the bar... sinky... nice... always like a bar where there is an amusement park type attraction.  Meh.

Anyhow - I lived almost four years in San Francisco without knowing about Underground SF and honestly I don't think I was missing anything at all.
author: Kate R.

description:
Where o' where do I begin?  I think I am going to dedicate this one to the ladies who may randomly end up at Sf Underground in the future.  

A couple of my girlfriends and I ended up here to meet a friend for some hanging out and disco music.  What we did not expect was a half naked mess of people gyrating on each other and looking at us with horrified expressions on their sweaty faces. Seriously, as we walked through the club it parted as though it was the red sea.  Yes we have breasts, but we dont bite. 

So we walk through the mess of people in search of a bathroom.  Well, ladies, you definitely want to bring a friend with you.  As there is only a see through curtain separating you from the dance floor, you will want your friends to stand in front of it to give you a little privacy and to keep people from peeking their heads in to a) see if you are a hot guy or b) yell at you to hurry the fuck up.  

But wait...the night seriously got better.  At one point, I am not sure when (or why), we went from icky girls to the shit.  Guys were dancing with us, providing blockades so we didnt get pushed around and grinding on us.  It felt so good to be loved!  And I got to freak with guys and not feel slutty the next morning!  A special thanks to Chris, LA Guy and East Coast Shirt Guy for making this night possible.
author: Stacy R.

description:
We have been doing Tuesday nights here since 98 or 99.  I personally could never imagine being somewhere else doing what we do.

Big up the Cippa for putting in the new sub.  St. Patrick's Day is going to be an immaculate disaster this year.

All hail.

I am going to say that it's wheelchair accessible because I remember once years ago we boosted some wheelchair junglist up the stairs onto the dancefloor so that he could rave where the speakers were hittin.
author: Max I.

description:
Great experience one Saturday night.  Bartenders are funny, quick and knowledgeable about drinks.  Plus the music is great!

Totally not my scene.  Clearly, I DID NOT belong here.  Came for a friend's birthday.  Tons of hot boys, but I was certain that none of them were into me because each and every one of them were probably interested in each other... know what I mean?!?

Will never go back again...  unless ...  never mind, ... NO, I will never go back.  

Saturday night fun = D&H... Drunk & Horny, baby :-)!
author: Celeste M.

description:
I've been here a couple of times.   Each time I'm not that impressed.  I don't like to pay covers, especially not for bars like this... and yet I gave in and paid because enough of my friends were already inside.
The last time I was there (March 6th) the music was SO LOUD that we couldn't stand it.  It actually hurt my ears... and I'm not the type of person that covers their ears when a fire engine drives by.  We left after only being there for a couple of songs.
Seriously, my ears were ringing for about 30 minutes after we left.  

no thank you
author: Ingrid S.

description:
The night has come and you're in the Haight walking around ready to kill your liver. Your liver is telling you no but do you ever listen to it? NO! You walk through the entrance which leads into a small dive bar with music blaring and the smell of vodka, funk, and old wood comes at you in great force. You look around and notice everyone is wasted and having a great time. You pause to take this in because you love getting wasted in Dive bars. 

To the bar you head where you start off with the first drink. The drink being 99% vodka and 1% red bull, you will not earn your wings. You will be drunk and joining in on the crazy scene which introduced its self moments ago. Up two steps you go and head to a dance floor packed with people. Its rather small but just enough room to get in and show the others you can move. 

Now hot and ready for some air you head to the back where an enclosed patio greets you. The patio is packed with smoker, a few people who are passed out, and tons of patrons sharing stories. This dark gloomy bar has won over your attention. You head back to the bar 5-6 times and repeat the steps above. 

Then you come into work with 2 hours of sleep and yelp about it!



The Top.. oopps Underground SF..
author: Jay D.

description:
What a shock to find this gem! Thank God! We (gay boys) needed a new and improved place to dance, cruise, hang out and generally get into some fun and trouble. An excellent mix of meatheads, castro-clones, tender-tots, and your below market boys..all to great music and visuals. Mixed crowd, fun girls, friendly guys, cheap drinks and in the Haight!
I hope to see this really take off and become my new gay dive!
author: Jason D.

description:
Don't get confused with the 3 stars that are being used to represent this review. I don't, in any way, consider this bar to be maintaining the status quo. With that being said, let's get into it.

I used to go here when it was still a kept secret and not the crowded hole it is today. Back then it was fun. A lot of cute boys having their mai tai's and cosmos talking about nothing I care to hear in the front of the club. People getting down on the dance floor as you go towards the middle and then the cool crowd of hipsters, hippies, you get the idea....hanging in the back. Never crowded but just enough people inside to make it feel like it was still a good night to be out.

Let's Pan over to Late 06' - Current 07'.

Fun as this club was/is. I don't envision myself coming back here for a while. I was charged a different cover for entry than my friends in front of me were, it's too crowded on the inside and people really should learn to tread lightly, or at least say excuse me...Rude. It takes half the night to get a drink in this fucker, only to have them make it wrong and have to stand in line again-The latter happened to me twice. Another time I came in there was this black guy chillin in the middle of the stairwell with 3 or 4 snakes on him, not my kind of party. Apparently the danger of 4 wild reptiles doesn't bother Underground SF....thats whatev. To make it all worse. This place has it's bathrooms right in the middle of the dance floor. It is hard to dance with someone when you have a long as line dividing you. 

3 stars for awesome memories. -2 stars for things I'll never forget. It will take some strong arguments to get me to step inside there anytime soon.
author: James J.

description:
I'm down with underground stuff. Really. But this place....

$3 to go into a room that looks like a transformed garage and smells like it hasn't been mopped in a year. I'm not even kidding- we left because of the smell.

I didn't know it was a gay bar till I started writing my review. I didn't notice it that night when I came with my boyfriend and his [straight] roommates. I didn't drink but the guys said the drinks were the "cheapest, most disgusting ones we've ever had." They left their gin & tonics practically untouched. 

So why am I giving this place more than 1 star? 

The scene. 

The regulars seemed to have a lot of fun-- we were there for some 50s style dance party-- and all knew each other. Everyone was friendly and it felt like a party in someone's basement.

So verdict? If we walk by and it's free, I'll go again. But $3 for 20 minutes ain't worth it.
author: Emilia S.

description:
The Top was better than Underground SF.

the place is a mere shadow of its former self, but still pretty bangin.  go there on TUESDAY for $5 phuturo, one of the longest running drum'n'bass weekies out there.  recognize!  the sound used to be dope, then it got busted, then it got fixed, so its pretty good now and works fine but could be bigger.  but for a small venue its aight.

big bar, easy to get drinks.  good average drinks.  water available on the end.  lots of places to sit.  elevated dance floor, 2 nasty bathrooms and a smoking area.  all good.

a nice semi-grungy but chill bar to hang out and dance at.  i only go tuesdays for d'n'b and rare saturdays, so take your chances on the others days...
author: Junglist S.

description:
To be straightforward, I've only been here once. 

But it was fun and a good crowd, good music. 

I found a credit card, driver's license, and $25 in cash on the floor while I was dancing, and decided to be a freakishly good Samaritan and return it all. The bartender that took it from me just grabbed it and then moved on, but the other bartender offered to buy me a drink for my good deed :)

Anyway, it was a fun place for a night out.
author: Casey N.

description:
Toto, we're not Cole Valley anymore.  Trippy dark ground floor subterranean.  You do what you want, dress for yourself, dance what feels good.  No mirrors, Micky, nobody checking themselves out.  Crowded, incense haze, dreamy lights, prompt bar.

A gay joint, really?  You could push me over with a feather boa, I don't notice these things.  Nobody pinched my ass.  I thought I saw women here, at least they looked like women and who's met trannies in pigtails, tights and hiking boots?
author: Gil S.

description:
In all honesty the only time I came here was for Drunk & Horny and by then I had already done a few rounds at what used to be Bar on Castro. All I remember was cheap drinks, a very un-castro gay crowd, bumpin' music, hot boys and dropping something very important on the ground. 
Would like to go back and check it out in a more sober state of mind.
author: Joey C.

description:
I've only been here for Drunk and Horny and let me tell you that this bar is fantastic.

The service is standard, not slow but not fast by the bars but the music and scenery of D&N will make up for it. Lots of sweaty boys who managed to get the party started... and they all seemingly fit the name of the party...


...drunk....


...horny....


It's a good escape away from the Castro and the cover is not that bad for the party they provide. Just make sure you come drunk and horny like the name or some of your counterparts at the party might freak you out when they try and bag you for a one-night stand.
author: Kim D.

description:
This is a weird spot.  I used to go on Wednesday nights.  Usually not too packed, good music, and good stiff drinks.  There is dancing too.

There is nothing really attractive or appealing about this spot however. Nothing that makes me say, "wow, I'd like to go back there again."

I think if it came under new ownership, or if the current ownership did some renovations, they could really turn things around.
author: lea m.

description:
oh, so terrible. 
worst layout to a bar (feels crowded and awkward), crappy drink deals, and the most disgusting bathrooms i've ever seen -- they didn't bother putting a lock on the ladies room door. what is that?-- must cost $4 and take 5 minutes of their time to replace it. 

so, dance floor smells like a toilet.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Cheb I Sabbah - with the phenomenal release of La Kehna, this club has turned you in a asian underground deejay guru. Spinning Karsh Kale to Midival Punditz, Bally Sagoo to Talvin Singh, every Wednesday night at SF Underground, Cheb I 'jee' is a boon to the Lower Haight music scene. 

I'm a regular now. And so is someone else ;-)
author: Sav B.

description: I hate paying covers. Even $5. I went for Gemini Disco night with my buddies from work. (They really wanted to go dancing.) There was a real variety of people, which is important to me. All 70's music is too much for me (as opposed to 80's, which is never too much), and the dance floor is directly against the bathroom, which is sort of gross. But, I had fun - people dressed for the occasion - and people weren't afraid to get freaky.
author: Andrew K.

description:
My one experience here was a great one - Thursday night was the new "Let it Grow" even that will become a weekly thing - featuring grassroots Hip Hop and Live Art all night long.

... check out the walls in the back, painted to perfection by local artistic talent. Come early... even if you dont' its only a $5 cover for some SICK DJing and art.

http://www.undergroundsf.com/
http://www.myspace.com/undergroundsf
author: Lauren S.

description:
What unites hippy chicks seeking instant nirvana and pretty boys seeking instant hook ups ? Underground SF where the pretty boys go to the gay lecious Drunk and Horny Saturdays while the hippy chicks(among others)go  to dance to the celebrity world music dj cheb I sabah on wednesdays. Per yelp's management's guidelines, I hereby disclose my vested interest due to my long term friendship with chebi sabah. I possess the unique distinction of making him infuriated when I fell asleep  while driving him back from Sierra Nevada world music festival after a weekend of SUBSTANCE tial abuse and (sleep) depravity.

Underground SF is where the biblical prophesy of Mark( Seek and thy shall receive) comes true. You only need to choose the right night for your longings to be fulfilled.
author: Kaustav C.

description:
I've only been there once with some friends but it was a great time. I couldn't walk when I left and I couldn't get out of bed the next day but it was worth it. 
I would definitely go back and definitely recommend it. Cool dancing and nice looking and eclectic crowd.
Drinks are strong.
author: Mikey M.

description:
I went there for the Killswitch happy hour, which is now every Friday from 6-10 pm, and I must say I had a good time. If your into electronic music this is a good place to be, the residents DJ Javaight and dCOY know their tech-house and minimal and maintain a good vibe that lends itself to dancing or just hanging out and chatting with your friends. 
The bartender there was nice and they do have cheap drinks, $4 Margaritas, $3 Stella Artois, and of course, $1 PBRs. Its a nice place to start off the weekend.
author: Maxwell G.

description:
What's great about this place is that they aren't afraid of filling those extra little nitches - They have an amazing Reggae night with one of the best DJs in the city...as well as a Disco night every first Saturday which totally packs the house. The Hip Hop nights are great because the large dance floor and amazing sound system really pump you up. :-)

The bar is fully stocked and they are open to making you whatever you want...which is a nice change from those bartenders who look at you sideways when you ask for something complicated. 
Lots of beers on tap and drink specials up the wazzooo...

All the peeps who come here are also totally amazing and nice. I've made lots of random friends there. It's just the kinda place that OOozes fun and entertainment. I'm never left disappointed.
author: Katy A.

description:
Crowded! Dang!

While this place can be fun, it's so hit and miss.

Lately it's been ok, but last weekend it was dead. DEAD!

But I will say that it's cool when you want to go dancing, and you have a tall friend with you, and he's like "Get on the box and dance" and you're like "I can't...there's people's drinks on the box." and he just levels them all on the floor.

That's some fucking classic shit.

[Oh...sorry if that was one of your drinks...]
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Oh, how I love an honest to goodness neighborhood, dive bar! While not in my neighborhood and way nicer than many a dive I've seen, SF Underground is the puurrrfect spot for some drinks and grooves with a chill crowd on a Friday evening. 

Why Friday evening, you ask? Well, I'm a sucker for Friday happy hour. And Killswitch happy hour on Fridays is just right.  

I'll see you there darlings!

P.S. Major props for the absolutely decent sound system. It's shake your ass sound! Thank you, thank you!
author: Darling N.

description:
If you're going out with your favorite coworker where would you go?  Uh, Underground SF, DUH.

We went for drunk and horny night.  I'll spare you the details, but the company I was keeping was definitely drunk and surely horny.

Kinda bummed by the fact that I was in a bar with ALL boys and NONE of them were checking me out.  And if they were... they were checking to see if I was a "real" girl.  Gay bars + Caitlin = look, but don't touch... but at least there's a LOT to look at
author: Caitlin D.

description:
This club is a nice get-a-way from the usual destination that we all know of.

What I like about this club is first the clash of 80's and 70's music. The decor takes you back to a simple time in life when knowing, what someone did or where they lived never enter the conversation.

I love the mix of the crowd. hip-hop boys,local boys,gutter- punk boys,foreign boys,emo boys, girls, and older guys with tight t-shirts acting like boys.

The toilets could use alittle work thou. But it's in the haight so what you expect lol

You can get it all  right here! Drinks are great, staff is friendly!!!! I love the night Drunk and Horny I think I got laid there too.

You may get laid there too!
author: Joey G.

description: I miss the grungy patio. I miss the couch. I miss the graffiti. The drinks are cheap and they play great music. What more can you ask for?? then smoke a cig in the patio . yum!
author: Berenice D.

description:
I think I would have given this place 5 stars about 5 years ago when I first moved to SF and my weekends consisted of druken sweaty debauchery with my gaggle of gays.

As I am now older and no longer frequent the End Up, Undergound SF isn't really for me anymore.

I had a good time hanging with my friend Greg in the way back, perched on a stool watching the crowds come and go.  The miniature dance floor was RIDICULOUS.  I fought through it to pee once.  It was literally piss poor planning on where the pisser is.  While I have no qualms about peeing behind a flimsy sheer in the darkness of a blacklight, i'm sure the crowd, who already are not fans of the vagina, did not want to witness, so I was grateful to the guy in line behind me who was cool enough to stand guard in front of the sheer.

"Kisses!"  he smiled and kissed my cheek when I left.

I loved that.
author: Jen I.

description:
I went here on a Friday night around 1:00, which is so late by SF standards that I'll try to overlook the fact that there were like ten people there, none of them cute.

But the prices are insane for what this place is.  I paid $8 for a shot of Makers Mark after already getting charged a cover, which is like what you'd pay at Clock Bar only, feh, you're at Underground.  And it is dark and unpleasant.
author: Kevin Z.

description: I think I was here on a Friday night, watching my good friend's band, enjoying awesome company and cheap drinks. The place was crammed, but I danced the night away, and the doorman who reads Palaniuk and Vonnegut is awesome. We forced him to take a picture with us. Sorry, Anthony, we heart you.
author: Natasha P.

description:
Underground is a cool bar; the guy who runs it also tends bar some times (and also owns My Place in SoMa), and is a sweet guy.  

it's a small space, and a bit divey/edgy; much like the Lower Haight. there's an open space in the back for sheltered smoking.

i give it 5 stars is because the barstaff are friendly and hard-working, and because i love the Drunk & Horny party that happens there every saturday.
author: alex j.

description: Went here with a mixed group of str8/gay and it was cool.  $5.00 cover charge seemed crazy as I havent paid a cover in ages.  It was 90's something or another but I was pretty wasted upon arrival so I just had a long island that was really expensive but strong as F*CK.  The crowd was rowdy but not in the pushing you down kind of way.  I had a good time and met some cool folks.
author: Adam B.

description:
Somehow, my memories tell me that I had a great time at this place, but then I remember 

that I had to pay 5 dollars to get in, 

that the place was waaaaayyyyyy too crowded, like insecure-nobody-gets-out-of-here-if-a-fire-breaks-out crowded,

and that I never managed to get a drink because it was impossible to get to the bar...

and suddenly it doesn't feel like it was that great anymore. The music, however, was great. Or so I recall. And I'm sure on a weekday it might live up to the hype. During the weekends, though, just go to Nikies for a mean Mango Mojito. Really.
author: Jorge C.

description:
Another crappy gay bar in San Francisco.  What is it about this city? I thought it was supposed to be "the gay city." You'd think with such a reputation it'd pay to be gay here. Unfortunately not, instead we get crowded closet sized bars that stink.

Always -too- crowded. The dance floor is small. Theres only one bathroom and its on the dance floor. The smoking room is a joke.
author: Joshua G.

description:
music was unbelievably amazing the night I went! Thats where the 2 stars came from... Pounding bass beats made me wanna shake my groove thing!

crowd: all looked like they shopped at american apparel, and color coordinated their outfits with each other... lots of hipster mustaches and "too cool for school" attitudes

bartenders: WEAK SHIT!! worst pour of my life, and they both had really bad hair and black matching muscle shirts on. at least those beefcakes didnt have mustaches.

dont plan on going back anytime soon

ps: sparks promoter was already out of promo drinks before 10:30 and they were advertised as being free till midnight... booooooo
author: c e.

description:
Cool, small, dirty.  That pretty much sums it up.  The ladies room was (and probably always is) repulsive; piss, wetness, and ammonia fumes.  Made me wish I had tongs.  But the bigger offense: no mirror.  Get out!  

Drinks aren't expensive, the bartender is nice, and there's a grungy little dance floor next to the dj's booth.  

Post Script: had no idea about this bar's sexual orientation.  Wtf!? Did I go on straight night?  I saw nary a gay guy. The bartender's tight, like really fucking tight tank top shoulda tipped me off.  My gaydar must be bent.
author: julie c.

description:
Every Saturday Underground SF is transformed into "Drunk and Horny". The atmosphere of this bar/club nestled in lower Haight is a far cry from the pretentious, bubble gum pop clubs that scatter the Castro. While those establishment are fine in doses D&H is all around a good time. The boys are hot (esp the go-go boys who come on around 11:30), the drinks are strong, and a good variety of music.

The only downside is that it is a small venue and gets so crowded around  eleven that you are bumping and squeezing into people to get around. Note this can be a good think if you know how to properly navigate the crowds. (Hint squeeze in between the hottest boys so you can get your feel on) =)

D&H is an all around good time as has yet to lose the energy it had the first night it opened when I went.
author: Jeffrey F.

description:
Nice layout, with a pretty sweet dance floor. The back patio is always swell, at least when they open it. Decent prices on drinks too.
I've never seen it on a night where I wasn't going for a specific event, so who knows the vibe otherwise.
author: Matt L.

description:
I'm giving this place 3 stars because it can go either way depending on what is going on there on a given night.  They get great local DJs and the crowd will really vary depending on the party.   I was there for WORK last Thursday...it was really good, 

On the plus side:
 
 -The DJs were dope, Loose Shus (Luzius?) AWESOME!

 -The sound IS really good in this place  
 
 -Rsvp'd online +4, we all got in for free 
 
 -Ordered 2 drinks, got 4 drinks...dude what?  

--BEGIN SCENE--

"Barkeep!!! wha happan?"
        "2-4-1 well drinks before 11."
"2 more vodkas, rocks! chop chop!"

--END SCENE--

I didn't really boss around the bartenders, cause those guys make large stiff drinks and slang 'em for cheap!!  Great in my book!!

On the (potential) minus side:  

 -The place is pretty small.  

 -It is certainly a dive (if you google map it the street view picture has a homeless guy sleeping in front of the place, ISYN).  

 -It gets really hot, sweaty and crowded.

I say "potential," because: 
 
 -It's small, BUT it has a dance floor and gets some good DJs
 
 -It's a dive, BUT I like dives (it's a good dive)
 
 -It gets hot sweaty, and crowded, BUT...sometimes...when the bass is pumping, and people are all hammered (like 1am-ish), hot, sweaty, and crowded is a good thing!  

Look online, see what's going on before you go and you might just get a 5 STAR NIGHT out of a 3 STAR BAR.
author: Garrett C.

description:
This bar sucks. It is dirty and you run the risk of getting shot when you go outside.  The smoking area in the back is sort of cool, but that's it.
The bar is a dump.
Go there at your own risk.
author: Ivanna C.

description: I had a blast here on Saturday night. The cover is a bit steep for the size of this place, but it was worth breaking away from the stagnate Castro scene for this place. The hot go go boys didn't hurt either.
author: Tyler D.

description: The DJs that spin here are very good and you cannot help but listen actively--that is, stand up and dance.  Now that is music to my ears (or rather, feet).  The dance floor can get mad crowded, but that is only because the music can get that good.  But, the people are cool, no groping, drooling, or ogling.  Everyone is out to enjoy the music and have a good time.  Other than the bar area, there is a booth against the wall for seating.  The drinks are cheap.  There is a small outdoor area in the back where people smoke or take a breather.  I come on weeknights, especially Tuesdays, and there is a cover.
author: Dee C.

description: hee hee hee.  I like the DnB nights.  Who the hell is the female dj there?  I always forget her name but she so tears it up .  She is my goddess.  Good times.
author: Joyhan S.

description: Nothing will ruin your night more than the guy you dig going home with trashy bar staff who can't be bothered to wear pants to work.
author: Aaron Z.

description: I've had both fun and disappointing times at Underground SF. I used to go every now and then on Saturday night for the gay party called "Drunk and Horny". I had a horrible time the first couple of times I went (it gets really crowded in there, so if you're in the mood for that it can be atrocious). But then I went again more recently and had a decent time. As pointed out by Brandon C, you could sometimes wish for more eye-candy, but the crowd is fun and the dancing can be good after a few drinks. It can get a little raunchy on the dance floor. And if you're cute or give the googly eye to the doorman you might get invited to the after party (to which I haven't been, so I can't comment on that). 3-1/2 stars.
author: David S.

description: God I love this place!  Where does one go on a weeknight to enjoy some reggae, hip hop, mellow jams??  Here!!  I've always stumbled into this place late...un-planned...very spur of the moment but I always have a kick ass time.  The weeknights I've gone on have not been super crowded but the crowd is a crazy good mix of super mellow people who just want to enjoy the good vibes and dance/drink/smoke/socialize.  Just my style.  I like the little "patio" out back.  Couches are always a good thing.   Cheap drinks...good service....GREAT music!!  Funky chill atmosphere.  I recommend stumbling in here at any time :P
author: karla k.

description: not much really to rate, bar, DJ booth, dance floor.
author: Pickle R.

description: I went here with a friend Saturday night for The Drunk and Horny Party. Let me tell you someone should have called the Fire Marshall. All of Castro was in that one tiny space.We were able to make it to the front of the bar after much grabbing and rubbing. Then it took the bartenders a good 10 minutes to get us a drink although we were right there. The crowed was so cute it wasn't cute anymore. It was so pretty even I couldn't stand it anymore. This is one place were they should have a crowed control and not let in more people than they accommodate.   My friend and I stood near the front of the bar finished our drinks and were out with in 5 minutes.  I don't think I will go back there again.
author: Teddy d.

description:
First of all. This place should not be considered a "Gay Bar" It does have a gay night on Saturday nights and also one of their monthly parties but the rest is various themes.
The themed parties are definitely the strength of this place. It totally depends on the party as to how many and what kind of people will be there.  They do also have weekly clubs like the Tuesday night Drum and Bass which is always good.
They have a Dub Step party once a month which is pretty good. It's basically like drum and bass and the crowd is cool. 
The best thing about the place is a monthly party called "Die, Die, my Darling" which is the name of a Misfits song. As you can guess it's mainly horror punk and death rock, 1 dollar drinks that look like you're drinking blood, and Blood Wrestling!! That's right. Not mud wrestling. Blood Wrestling!!! Which is pretty much unprecedented as far as I know and for a $5 cover charge it's WELL worth it. 
Also I'm in agreement with the other reviewers about the bathroom setup. Being a guy, it's not too bad because the door is over in the corner of the dance floor, but for the girls their door is right in the middle so they have to wait right in the middle of the dance floor to go to the bathroom. Other than that it's a cool place and the bartenders there OWN!!
author: Dave C.

description: This is a warning to all the ladies out there who might be looking for a place to dance.  I made the mistake of coming here on a Saturday "Drunk and Horny" night - purportedly the biggest gay party in town - with four gals and two gays.  I got pretty much what I expected: sweaty men without shirts (and, in some cases, pants) rubbing up against each other on the overly-crowded dance floor.  If that's your thing, you should be all over it, but it was all just a little too much for me.  No, wait, a lot too much for me.
author: Rachel B.

description: 2$ is almost as good as it gets for a dance club cover. The place is small, but not crowded. Great drinks. And a really hot girl made out with me.
author: Mark A.

description: Went to see a friend spin here last night. No cover charge, friendly doorman, hugely huge Makers rocks. I used to sneak my underage ass in here when it was called 13%, a million years ago, and it's "charms" haven't changed. (Um, Can someone tell me when exactly the Lower Haight became Hayes Valley?)
author: J. R.

description: So dirty it's good. Cip the owner/bartender is a rock star behind the bar. Music is functional house, with a hot and sweaty dance floor just like I like it. I could have skipped the boy dancing in a speedo on the bar, but the beer-bong serving guy is a nice touch. You best sweat out your beverages, b/c the goings on in the bathroom are vile. However, being the only female there of a Saturday night is not a bad thing, trust me.
author: Gretchen T.

description:
this places spells t-r-o-u-b-l-e everytime i go.

it starts out tame, then everyone is literally drunk & horny, or pees in their pants from too much sTeLLa.

Saturdays are the best for Drunk & Horny. The most random things happen in the back patio where cigarettes come in a far second from what gets really smoked back there. My friend Mike ended up making out with a guy dressed in a bear costume (yeah, like Smokey) who was with other animal fellows. I had to slap myself to ensure I wasn't Jonny in Wonderland and realized it was all happening.

woof woof!!
author: Jonny M.

description:
So, I have only been to Underground SF for the "Drunk and Horny" soiree they host the last Saturday of Month...or is it the second and fourth Saturdays?...or is every other Thursday when the moon is full? Who knows.
Anyway, the first time I went it was a blast. Good music, HOT boys and crowded in the good way. Drinks are on the strong side - to say the least. The only downside was that the line for the bathroom is basically on the dance floor. No very convenient for the dancers or the people in line.
On a side note, is anyone else afraid that those big rotating cubes are going to fall on somebody?
The second time I went, even more fun. More of a crowd, HOTTER boys, better music..blah,blah,blah
Then, as with all good things, word seemed to get out. When I say get out, I mean that they must have put up a billboard in Fremont. (No offense to those people in Fremont - what am I saying? They don't have computers in Fremont so no one is going to read this anyway :) )
The last few times I went it was TOO CROWDED. Where the hell is the Fire Marshall? I mean you couldn't walk...literally. I waited 30 minutes - 30 MINUTES! - for drinks. Talk about a buzz kill. Strangely enough, I still managed to have a good time. Haven't been back in a while. Maybe I'll check it out again, but next time I'm wearing an asbestos suit in case the place catches fire. God knows, no one will ever get out.
author: Jamie M.

description: I love hen The Pop Off parties! I always have so much fun. The Dj's are amazing . To check out there mix check out www.myspace.com/popoffdanceparty. Indie dance electro music is revolutionary and these guys are BOOMING it like angels music to my ears.
author: Daisy A.

description: dance floor. booze. boys. cool staff. great location. i'm in!!
author: kiki b.

description: Yes the bathrooms are scary as F#$%, yes this place can get packed, yes it is a dive. But I am a dive bar type of girl and I LOVE THIS PLACE LIKE A FATTY LOVES THE $ MENU! Cip and his bartenders rock so does the doorman-Professor Keef! Hello Tuesday nights.
author: malarky j.

description:
the place is small. 
good crowd.
the dancefloor was super hot.  
2-for-1 well drink special (only on weds?)...always awesome! 
good music...everything made you want to shake that ass!
author: Linda N.

description: I've been here once. We went here around midnight and the place was empty, we single handedly tripled the occupants when we walked in the door. The beer was cold and I really enjoyed the music (top 40/ hip hop). I'll come back eventually to get a better idea of the scene.
author: D J.

description: Went last night for Drunk and Horny, the Sat night party (now every week). It was a bit rainy and is the season of parties after all, but the crowd was jumping by 11 and was a great mix of guys (mostly 20s/early 30s). The music was great (mostly vintage hits) and there was a nice energy and relatively friendly crowd. Everyone seemed to be having a great time. The drinks are nice 'n strong!
author: Mark V.

description: I've only been here for Drunk & Horny, and it was such a let down. The place is tiny and its so packed and crowded inside. Its kind of a cookie cutter establishment except this is the cookie you messed up on and comes out deformed. I go out to have a good time and dance, but just like the other San Francisco establishment aimed for the gays on Fridays and Saturdays, theres no room to do so. I have no desire of coming back to anytime soon.
author: Rocky K.

description: Good music - but awfully dirty inside. Plastic cups a no no. Not my scene. I didn't care for this place, but to each is own.
author: melissa h.

description: I give you four, just because I think that the drinks are overpriced, I dont like anything over four, it requires me to get more than a thirty out to drink, yes a thirty. I like that i trip either on the stairs to the smoking area or to the dance floor or on someones feet. I dont know why. I also like that it is in a small space, and yet I dont feel claustrophobic like i do in bar which is a big space. I go only for Drunk and horny and yet find that people are neither, or the fact that I dont register when people check me out, which I dont, can I get some ass grab people? I will give you the evil eye if I dont like you but I still appreciate the ass grab. mmm ass grab. I have yet to be so fucked up to not leave, well that's a lie, but I havent gotten thrown out yet and that is a good thing. RIGHT. The music is good.
author: Ryan O.

description: ok, so apparently i came here with Gil and Sav after Blur the other night.... by this time though the events of the evening are pretty fuzzy. the funny thing is, i actually forgot about this place but remember that everyone thought it was my birthday and that i liked the crowd. whats even funnier to me is that this place is located in the lower haight. i never hang out in the lower haight. pretty much ever. from what i can remember though, i had a really good time and i liked the crowd. did i mention that yet? that's all i'm going to say. those who were there know. haha
author: Michelle I.

description: I had no friggin clue this place existed eventhough its literally, right around the corner. Ill say this. It gets four stars for the time warp. I go here to support my friend III (pronounced Three) cuz he does fucking dope visuals for trance music. Granted, his visuals and many beer make trance tolerable. And thats the time warp. I was never a raver, but i made the beats and crap rolled up DJ's would spin. But dude, this was like 1994, before i had ever heard of dark drum and bass, which is the only electronic shit ill listen to. The inside is pretty well cut up, and has a pretty sweet, but creepy patio. Kinda looks like the patio  Corbin Bernsen and the snakes get you cornered in, in your dream. Funny story, there was this party in Baltimore, B'More as the kids call it, and this kid is hard trippin in X, and ...who the fuck am i kidding. Nothing about Ravers is funny. Beer and drinks are cheaper than strippers from Zona Roja, and smell just as strong.
author: Mick F.

description: the venue itself is pretty grungy but really chill.  last night, dj cheb i was spinning and he was great which is why i give underground sf 4 stars.  i was tricked into going here but i got over it when i heard the music.  i guess the genre is world music but it was mostly middle eastern and indian mixed with different beats.  when i hear world music, i usually think of enya or yanni like stuff which i'm not into but the music last night was great.  i'd go back for cheb i.
author: Seong P.

description: I went here the other week for drift (ladies house music club every third Thursday $5 cover).  I had only been once before, 2 yrs ago, right after I moved to sf. I think it was during drunk and horny. It was totally crowded so crowded I couldn't move, and I left approx 5 min later.  so coming back now, it seemed like a whole new place. Parking is horrible around here. That is the worst drawback. Other than that, the club is a small but comfy space...bar in front, a lil dance floor at back, slightly elevated dj booth at the side. The sound system is better than the transfer, where that club nite had moved from.  This is definitely not a fancy club, but I like that type anyway. Oh, and water was only $2!! CHEAP!!  Oh and the other bad thing was although it wasn't packed, the club was HOT. I was wearing a skirt and tank top but was still dying of heat (hence the water). Don't come wearing a lot of clothing.  The coat check was charging a couple of dollars but the only thing I could see where the coat check sign was, was a bench with people's jackets thrown onto it. I wouldn't pay for that.  I know a lot of different club nites are moving themselves over to this venue, so you should be able to have a good time.
author: Merredith L.

description: strong pour!! love it!!!  i was one of 4 women there, all the rest guys. it was packed with sweaty bodies.  i had a great time!  ladies, if you want to dance and just dance and not be attacked, come here on a night where everyone is either gay or bi.  other than that, it's a divey bar that spins some dope beats.
author: regina k.

description: Ohhh. die die my darling yes please!! I had so much fun, it was my first time.  A little more blood spatter please.  This event was the most fun I've had in such a long time.  I came home with blood all over my face and I have never looked better!  Highly recommended to anyone who likes to hear a little punk with a little das ich.  And beers for a dollar...can it get any better?  Such a tease it's only once a month (first friday), but I guess you want more of what you can't have...right?
author: satya p.

description: Went here on a quiet Thursday night. Good drink specials (a shot and a coors on tap for $4? Not too shabby). Small, but that actually works to it's advantage for all you horny motherfuckers out there. The sound system is in particular, baller. Underground S.F. reminds me of the Bovine Sex Club on Queens West in Toronto (where U2 used to hang out), for all you Canadian ex-pats and people who have visited T-Dot.
author: Jeremy J.
